summary: Broadband service on tribal lands continues to lag behind the rest of the country, limiting tribes’ access to the Internet—especially in rural areas. In such areas, wireless broadband can help keep people connected. We testified that the Federal Communications Commission could do more to promote and support tribes' access to radio frequency spectrum that can be used for such wireless service. In the report on...
title: Tribal Broadband: FCC Should Take Efforts to Promote Tribal Access to Spectrum
